intro: Mesembryanthemum nevillei, commonly known as the Neville's ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces vibrant pink or yellow flowers during the cooler months, and its leaves often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Mesembryanthemum nevillei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
